Package com.amazonaws.services.simpleworkflow.flow.annotations

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    NullDataConverter
    To be used only by annotations as they do not support null parameters.
  • Annotation Types Summary 
    Annotation Type Description
    Activities
    @Activities annotation is allowed on interfaces to define a set of activities.
    Activity
    Optional annotation used on activity methods to override the name and version.
    ActivityCompletionRetryOptions  
    ActivityExecutionOptions  
    ActivityRegistrationOptions
    @ActivityRegistrationOptions is a required annotation, unless SkipTypeRegistration is provided, on either interface annotated with Activities or activity method.
    Asynchronous
    Call to @Asynchronous method always returns immediately without executing it code.
    Execute
    @Execute annotation is used on methods of interface annotated with Workflow to specify the entry-point for WorkflowType.
    ExponentialRetry
    This annotation can be used for retrying failures on any asynchronous executions.
    ExponentialRetryUpdate
    Used to update values of @ExponentialRetry without requiring workflow type version change.
    ExponentialRetryVersion
    Used to specify implementation version of a @ExponentialRetry annotation.
    ExponentialRetryWithJitter
    This annotation can be used for retrying failures on any asynchronous executions.
    GetState
    Indicates that method is used to retrieve current workflow state.
    ManualActivityCompletion
    @ManualActivityCompletion is an optional annotation meant to be used on implementations of activity methods to mark them to be completed asynchronously.
    NoWait
    Used to mark Promise arguments of @Asynchronous methods that should not be waited for.
    Signal
    @Signal annotation is used on methods of interface annotated with Workflow to specify the method to invoke when a particular signal is received by workflow execution with a matching name.
    SkipTypeRegistration
    This can be used on interfaces annotated with Activities or Workflow to specify no registration options are needed for ActivityType or WorkflowType defined by such interfaces.
    Wait
    Used to mark parameters of @Asynchronous method that should be waited to be ready.
    Workflow
    @Workflow annotation is allowed on interfaces to define a workflow.
    WorkflowComponentImplementationVersion
    Specifies supported implementation versions of a component used to implement workflow definition.
    WorkflowComponentImplementationVersions
    Used to specify supported implementation versions of components used to implement workflow definition.
    WorkflowRegistrationOptions
    @WorkflowRegistrationOptions is a required annotation, unless SkipTypeRegistration is provided, on interfaces annotated with Workflow.
